comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: So there is the mystery county class light cruiser in the background.   Same one as the view from Taronga ?

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: How many bridge workers can you spot? I think I can see a few up there...2 December, 1930 was a Tuesday...so they'd have been hard at it. ...there's a HMAS Australia v HMAS Canberra debate going on over at this pic www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/8434256498/ ...which might/might not have been taken a few days after this SRNSW pic... Note how over at www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/8434256498/ sailorsam4 drew attention to the Rear Admiral's flag, which is flown on the flagship...in December 1930 the flagship was HMAS Australia...though this changed as from 29/5/1931, when HMAS Canberra became the flagship nla.gov.au/nla.news-article29907266 ; so if we can be certain re the date on which a pic was taken, if we're lucky, the Rear Admiral's flag might be the key clue which would then enable us to distinguish between the two ships...HMAS Canberra later had alterations made to its bridge which makes it easier to distinguish between the two in later pics (maybe!)...but prior to this HMAS Australia and HMAS Canberra appear to have been almost identical...though as this pic shows, HMAS Australia (at least) had its name on the stern, port side... trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16828660
